page.title: 03HOUSING ESTATES IN LALEHAM
page.content: All round Buckland school the houses are all in estates.Lots of the houses all look the same because they were built at the same time. We have tried to find out something about them.Nearest the school is a big council estate.It is about 30 years old.All the roads are called after the Royal Family like Edinburgh Drive and Elizabeth Avenue.In the grounds of the secondary school that is near us there is a Roman camp buried under its football pitch. The Pavilion Gardens estate was called after the beautiful gardens and tennis pavilion which went with the houses.In an old paper it said they cost Â£695 each.Another estate was built in 1960 on a nurery that used to grow tomatoes and flowers,so they called it Nursery Gardens.
